modules.description: Parses a string into a matcher that evaluates HTTP methods and paths against a set of rules, supporting wildcards and exact matches. It works with method and path patterns, including percent-encoded characters and suffix matching via "/**". The `allowed` function checks if a given method and path list are permitted by the matcher.

Provides functions to define and handle HTTP/JSON RPC endpoints with type-safe request and response handling. Works with custom protocol buffers and JSON-encoded data structures to ensure consistency between client and server. Used in the Tezos project to implement secure, structured RPCs for blockchain interactions.

Processes HTTP method and path patterns, supporting wildcards, exact matches, and percent-encoded characters. It defines a matcher type with an `allowed` function to validate lists of methods and paths against configured rules. Examples include checking if GET /users is permitted or validating POST /resources/** against a dynamic route. The module enables fine-grained access control based on structured URL and method patterns.
